meanings.definition: A fence made of pointed wooden or metal stakes
meanings.sent1: The palings around the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The old house had palings that needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the palings but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sharp palings, piercing through his heart.
meanings.sent5: The palings stood tall and proud, guarding the property from intruders.

meanings.definition: A row of pointed stakes forming a fence or boundary
meanings.sent1: The farmer installed new palings to protect his crops from animals.
meanings.sent2: Children played hide-and-seek behind the palings in the park.
meanings.sent3: The palings seemed to whisper secrets to each other in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The palings marked the edge of the forbidden forest, warning travelers to turn back.
meanings.sent5: The palings stretched as far as the eye could see, creating a barrier between the two properties.
